code_value: Mr. Jenkins, my old neighbor, was a very dull person who held conventional ideas and led an ordinary life. It came no great surprise when I discovered that his hobby was memorizing bus timetables. When asked, for example, how to get from an unknown part of the country to another, he could detail precisely which buses one would have to take, where to change, and how long the journey would last, but he could never conceal the expression of excitement that overcame him when he had met such a challenge.
